=== Accidents and incidents ===
=== Accidents and incidents ===
â
[[File:Aa191 ohare.jpg|thumb|The 1979 crash of American Airlines Flight 191 near O'Hare was the deadliest single-aircraft crash in American history.]]
 
1057 fatalities have occurred as a result of accidents en route to or from Chicago O'Hare.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aviation-safety.net/database/airport/airport.php?id=ORD |title=Aviation Safety Network > ASN Aviation Safety Database > Airports > Chicago-O'Hare International Airport, IL profile |publisher=Aviation-safety.net |date=July 13, 2008 |accessdate=November 3, 2010}}</ref>
1057 fatalities have occurred as a result of accidents en route to or from Chicago O'Hare.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://aviation-safety.net/database/airport/airport.php?id=ORD |title=Aviation Safety Network > ASN Aviation Safety Database > Airports > Chicago-O'Hare International Airport, IL profile |publisher=Aviation-safety.net |date=July 13, 2008 |accessdate=November 3, 2010}}</ref>
* On September 2, 2010, American Airlines Flight 1487 to Reno, Nevada was struck by lightning and forced to return. No one was hurt.
* On September 2, 2010, American Airlines Flight 1487 to Reno, Nevada was struck by lightning and forced to return. No one was hurt.
